attributes.action: Bring driverless trains on London Underground (#NoMoreStrikes)
attributes.additional_details: RMT are proposing another strike on Central Line on 21st and 22nd December because 2 drivers lost their jobs - one had opened the doors in between the stations and second failed the drugs test. Do you think that we deserve another strike because of those reasons?
attributes.background: We would like to ask the Government to consider bringing driverless trains on London Underground network. We (the customers) are fed up of strikes when trying to get to work. Our kids are also suffering long hours at nurseries because every strike adds extra couple of hours on daily commute.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because this would be the responsibility of Transport for London and not the UK Government or Parliament.

You can petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
